overview_of_class: This course examines two of the most important critiques of morality in Western philosophic tradition: Nietzsche's 'Beyond Good and Evil' and Bernard Williams' 'Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy'. It is centrally concerned with understanding what it means to offer a critique of morality. Topics covered will also include moral psychology, political realism, and questions of philosophical style.
name: Studies in the History of Ethical and Political Theory
title: WCAS PHIL 362-0-20 Studies in the History of Ethical and Political Theory
topic: Critiques of Morality, Nietzsche and Williams

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course examines two of the most important critiques of morality in Western philosophic tradition: Nietzsche's 'Beyond Good and Evil' and Bernard Williams' 'Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy'. It is centrally concerned with understanding what it means to offer a critique of morality. Topics covered will also include moral psychology, political realism, and questions of philosophical style.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: In this course, students will be introduced to two of the most important moral philosophers of the last 200 years and to some of the debates that their work has given rise to.
